sn11.21:4.2: And then Sakka, the Lord of Gods, went up to the Buddha,
sn11.21:5.1: “When what is incinerated do you sleep at ease?
sn11.21:5.2: When what is incinerated is there no sorrow?
sn11.21:6.1: “When anger’s incinerated you sleep at ease.
sn11.21:6.2: When anger’s incinerated there is no sorrow.
sn11.21:6.3: O Vāsava, anger has a poisoned root
sn11.21:6.5: The noble ones praise its killing,
sn11.21:6.6: for when it’s incinerated there is no sorrow.”
